shortdesc.ph: Adjusts the playback volume of a specified remote user.
Adjusts the playback volume of a specified remote user locally.
Adjusts the playback volume of a specified remote user locally.
Adjusts the playback volume of a specified remote user locally.

p.codeblock: abstract adjustUserPlaybackSignalVolume(uid: number, volume: number): number;
abstract adjustUserPlaybackSignalVolume(uid: number, volume: number): number;
Future<void> adjustUserPlaybackSignalVolume( {required int uid, required int volume});
public abstract int AdjustUserPlaybackSignalVolume(uint uid, int volume);

section.p: You can call this method during a call to adjust the playback volume of a specified remote user. To adjust the playback volume of multiple users, call this method multiple times.
You can call this method during a call to adjust the playback volume of a specified remote user locally. To adjust the playback volume of multiple users locally, call this method multiple times.
You can call this method during a call to adjust the playback volume of a specified remote user locally. To adjust the playback volume of multiple users, call this method multiple times.
You can call this method during a call to adjust the playback volume of a specified remote user locally. To adjust the volume for multiple users, call this method multiple times.

section.title: Timing
section.p: You need to call this method after joining a channel.
You must call this method after joining a channel.
You must call this method after joining a channel.
Call this method after joining a channel.

plentry.pd: The ID of the remote user.

The volume, with a range of [0,400].
0: Mute.
100: (Default) Original volume.
400: Four times the original volume, with overflow protection.

Volume. The range is [0,400].
0: Mute.
100: (Default) Original volume.
400: Four times the original volume with built-in overflow protection.
The ID of the remote user.

The volume, with a range of [0,400].
0: Mute.
100: (Default) Original volume.
400: Four times the original volume, with built-in overflow protection.

Volume, ranging from [0,400].
0: Mute.
100: (Default) Original volume.
400: Four times the original volume, with built-in overflow protection.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
